H0.text: It makes the ocean water saltier, which is one way that the formation of a coral reef—built from the hard outer skeletons of small marine organisms that live in groups—changes the ocean ecosystem.

H1.text: It removes sand from the ocean floor, which is one way the formation of a coral reef changes the ocean ecosystem.

H2.text: It causes ocean waves to become stronger when coral reefs form, thereby changing the ocean ecosystem.

H3.text: It creates a habitat for some ocean animals is a way the formation of a coral reef changes the ocean ecosystem.

A4.text: They occupy less than 0.1% of the world's ocean area, about half the area of France, yet they provide a home for at least 25% of all marine species
